name: jazzily

in a way that is like jazz music or involves jazz music: For their encore, the sisters improvised jazzily on themes by Gershwin. The score is jazzily easy on the ear.
More examplesFewer examplesHer current show is an intimate, jazzily laid-back affair.His debut solo album proved too jazzily languid to attract much attention. The finale consisted of a set of jazzily rearranged Russian-origin themes given freshly minted lyrics.The onstage band belted out one jazzily rousing number after another
